translation: Ordinary beings of the lowest class who are born in a lower realm (and wish to be reborn there) can commit all kinds of evil deeds.

source_sentence: 如此愚人多造罪(願往生)　　經歷地獄無窮劫(無量樂)
translation: Likewise, a sinner commits many sins and goes on to be reborn in hell for an infinite eon.

source_sentence: 臨終忽遇善知識(願往生)　　為說妙法令安穩(無量樂)
translation: At the end of his life, he suddenly meets a good teacher (and wishes to be reborn) who teaches him the wonderful Dharma and stability (with immeasurable joy)

source_sentence: 刀風解時貪忍痛(願往生)　　教令念佛不能念(無量樂)
translation: craving and patience of pain when the sword is dispassionate (and wishing to be reborn in the Pure Land)

source_sentence: 善友告言專合掌(願往生)　　正念專稱無量壽(無量樂)
translation: Good friend, he says, concentrate his palms together (and wish to be reborn in the Pure Land) with concentration called Immeasurable Life ( Amitabha).

source_sentence: 聲聲連注滿十念(願往生)　　念念消除五逆障(無量樂)
translation: Each sound is accompanied by ten kinds of joy:

source_sentence: 謗法闡提行十惡(願往生)　　回心念佛罪皆除(無量樂)
translation: of the ten sins committed by the crooked kṣatriyas who slander the Dharma (and wish to be reborn in the Pure Land), and of the sins eliminated through repentance and meditation on the Buddha (and so forth)

source_sentence: 病者身心覺醒悟(願往生)　　眼前即有金華現(無量樂)
translation: And the sick man’s body and mind are enlightened, and his wish is to be born.

source_sentence: 金華光明照行者(願往生)　　身心歡喜上華臺(無量樂)
乘華一念至佛國(願往生)　　直入大會佛前池(無量樂)
殘殃未盡華中合(願往生)　　十二劫後始華開(無量樂)
translation: And twelve aeon after that, the flowers will bloom and become immeasurable

source_sentence: 華內坐時無微苦(願往生)　　超過色界三禪樂(無量樂)
translation: When he was seated inside the lotus, there was no subtle pain (desire to be reborn) beyond the bliss of the third meditation in the form realm (an infinite bliss)

source_sentence: 般舟三昧樂(願往生)　　勉入地獄坐金蓮(無量樂)
translation: the bliss of the samādhi of prajñāpāramitā (which consists of wishing to be reborn)

source_sentence: 寧合金華百千劫(願往生)　　不能地獄須臾間(無量樂)
translation: It is better to combine a hundred thousand kalpas of wishing for rebirth with a hundred thousand kalpas of wishing for the flower of gold, which can't be hell for an instant (with measureless bliss)

source_sentence: 觀音大勢慈光照(願往生)　　徐徐為說安心法(無量樂)
translation: Avalokitêśvara's great power is like the light of compassion shining for all living beings (and wishing to be reborn in the Pure Land), and he slowly explains to them the Dharma of peace and comfort (with immeasurable joy).

source_sentence: 行者得聞希有法(願往生)　　智慧法眼豁然開(無量樂)
法眼開時見佛會(願往生)　　即發無上菩提心(無量樂)
translation: When the Dharma-eye of enlightenment is opened, he sees all the buddha-ssemblies (and wishes to be reborn).

source_sentence: 或坐或立遊行觀(願往生)　　到處唯聞說法聲(無量樂)
translation: Wherever he may sit, wherever he may stand, and wherever he may go, all he hears is the sound of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 身心毛孔皆得悟(願往生)　　菩薩聖眾皆充滿(無量樂)
translation: Their bodies and hair pores are all enlightened (and wish to be reborn in the Pure Land), and their bodies and hairs are all filled with joy.

source_sentence: 自作神通入彼會(願往生)　　憶本娑婆知識恩(無量樂)
若非釋迦勸念佛(願往生)　　彌陀淨土何由見(無量樂)
心念香華遍供養(願往生)　　長時長劫報慈恩(無量樂)
translation: offerings of incense and flowers to all living beings (and wishing them to be reborn)

source_sentence: 普勸十方生死界(願往生)　　同心斷惡盡須來(無量樂)
translation: To exhort all living beings in the ten directions to be born in the realm of birth-and-death (in which they wish to be reborn) with one mind, to eliminate evil and bring it to an end (with infinite joy)

source_sentence: 一入涅槃常住國(願往生)　　徹窮後際更何憂(無量樂)
translation: One, he enters nirvāṇa and always abides in the kingdom (and wishes to be reborn there) without sorrow (untold bliss).

source_sentence: 念念時中常證悟(願往生)　　十地行願自然成(無量樂)
translation: In each moment of thought, he always realizes enlightenment (by vowing to be reborn in the Pure Land) and naturally accomplishes the practices and vows of the ten stages (with infinite joy)

source_sentence: 地地慈悲巧方便(願往生)　　以佛為師無錯悟(無量樂)
定善依經十三觀(願往生)　　一一具說莊嚴事(無量樂)
translation: of the thirteen contemplations of the well-balanced absoṟption (which consists of wishing for rebirth)
